events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris – Machine Language
events.description:
Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris.  This week we'll be covering the chapter on Machine Language.  


"I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions  Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/• Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/• Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/build-a-computer/
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: May Meetup
events.description:
Hi folks! 

We look forward to having you join us for our May meetup, on the 31st, venue @ Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #16-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538. We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Winston or Guo Xiang) if your company would like to sponsoror if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips. See you on the 26th! Venue: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #16-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538 -------------- 1. "Rails + Postgres Cubes" - Mohammad Habbab from @tradegecko 2. "Features that shouldn't be" - @arnvald from @kaligohotels 3. "Performance tips for a Rails stack" - Althaf Hameez from @GrabSG 4. "5 Random Ruby Tips" - Song Yangyu 5. Announcements * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com,or Guo Xiang @tgx_world / tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it her -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Venue, Food and Drinks:
events.location: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #16-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538, Singapore

events.name: WordPress Meetup (May 2016)
events.description: Let's have a meetup for May! Jack Lenox, who spoke at our October 2015 meetup and at PHPConf.Asia, is in Singapore for a short while, and we've invited him to speak again. WordPress'ing Like a Boss: Jack will speak about things he's learnt since joining the WordPress.com VIP Team at Automattic, like basic security and performance, and how to use tools like Xdebug and PHP Codesniffer. Community Open Space: bring your WordPress questions and let the community help you with it!  Are you interested in sharing something about WordPress as well? Let us know! Venue: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, Third Floor, Singapore[masked] Do join us from 7pm for a 7:30pm start. Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :) We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Singapore & Hong Kong Startup Happy Hour
events.description:
Party with the General Assembly folks on the first day of the RISE Conference and get to know the startup scene in Singapore and Hong Kong. Come with your partners and friends! Drinks are on the house and great conversation is guaranteed.

Places are limited. RSVP for free here: http://bit.ly/1XHYvVk
events.location: Linguini Fini, 49 Elgin Street, Singapore Hong Kong
